갓겜

Although putting a review out for a game that's nearly 13 years old seems like it's a little too late, I'm still going to write this review anyways; and this is more of a general review for the entire HL2 series (no spoilers).
This has to be one of the best (if not the best) series I've played. With the combination of the voice actors, the fights against the Combine, and the story line (as well as Episode One and Episode Two). I never really understood why everyone was making "Half-Life 3 Confirmed" jokes, after the long gap from 2007, of the release of HL2: Ep.2, but after playing HL2, and both of the available episodes, I have somewhat joined the hype train. Not to the point where I try to set up equations to which the answer is 3, but enough to make me want to see where this series is going. Although HL2: Ep.3 or HL3 might never be released, what the series has right now is great, and anyone who doesn't own Half-Life 2, and Episodes One and Two, should get the games right now, and experience one of Valve's greatest game series to date.

Wake up and...play this game.
-G-Man

Es considerado el mejor juego de todos los tiempos, y puede ser que ese hecho sea verdad, yo no lo consideraria tan buen juego como para merecer tal honor, pero en verdad hay pocos juegos que te pueden dar experiencias tan gratificantes como pelear en el centro de la ciudad con la rebelion estilo Juegos del Hambre, entrar a un edificio y pelear adentro contra todo un ejercito, o simplemente luchar en lancha contra el gobierno retrogada.
Este juego mas que ser muy bueno, es una experiencia excelente.

I find it odd, that Half-Life 2, one of the titles that help build the community we now cherish so (steam), has been neglected by the company that runs this platform.  

I'm playing on super high end Hardware, using Windows 10, which may or may not be part of the problem.

This game which is one of the valves crowning achievements according to its fan base, is buggy and neglected.  Valve added native steam controller support two Left 4 Dead 2 and portal 2, I don't understand why they haven't Revisited this title with Native steam controller support or even some graphical adaptations and upgrades for modern machines.

Given their resources, it can't really be that hard? Right?

I would greatly appreciate it if anybody in the know could point me to some mods or patches they could repair this dumpster fire and allow it to play and some semblance of the great game that I'm sure it once was.

I truly do hope that valve we'll just decide to drop Half Life 3 with no prior press leaks or publicity...  if they did that it would probably send the community into almost Universal jubilation and perhaps bog down the interface like one of their summer sales does.

It would be like when Beyonce broke iTunes.

Hell I would love it if I'll put out a sequel to any of their excellent games....  You can dream, right?

The fine folks at crowbar Collective are putting out black Mesa as an update for Half Life 1, and I personally think it's a goddamn shame that valve didn't do it themselves.

I'm sorry that this is off topic but I just had to say it somewhere.

It makes me sad that a company that has made so many great games doesn't seem terribly concerned with making them anymore.

All that said, this game was ahead of it's time and is still a thrill ride to play. absolutely awesome....  Makes it even worse that valve isn't making a sequel. 

I just don't get it.

A masterpiece, one of the best FPS games of our times.

Everything is seen directly through Gordon's eyes and kind of making sense.

I know most of stuff in the game is BS, but it kind of just able to make me convinced that "This make sense" even if "That's bullcrap".

Again, you, the Brilliant scientist turned Super marine, has been called by G-man and be set on the journey of saving humanity from vicious aliens, The Combines.

Even if this game comes out before 2005, but I must say, most of its details, such as facial animations, water reflections, and so on... are actually better than some of games that came out in 2015 and after. It's just shame that some garbages just can't compare with this FPS masterpiece.

The setting however is more hardcore than in HL1. Ammunition management is really important, as some enemies barely even pose a threat toward if you know how to use melee. Sometimes, avoiding rush ahead into enemies, it's better just let them come which is another amazing AI designs by the time of 2004.
If you have 9,99€ and don't know what to spend it on, do yourself a favor and buy this masterpiece of a game that will never have a sequel but we can dream.

我看我的好友里面没人推这款游戏，也是我 真真切切打通关的一款游戏。剧情很简单主人公被关在了一个城市里，城市里面都是护卫队（坏人）然后你扮演陈胜，和吴广们一起农民起义。零几年的游戏，我最早玩还是在游侠网下载的盗版。趁这夏促补票上车。
起源引擎应该是所有fps玩家所要奉若神明的东西，没有它，就没有半条命，就没有cs，也就没有万物宗主cf了（嘿嘿）。很耐玩的一款游戏，有射击有解谜，有恐怖元素。各方面放在当时都是顶尖水平，现在也不输某些作品
[strike]假如G胖能出3，帮我转告他，藤壶怪真的很恶心，我不想看见那玩意了（哭）[/strike]

CLASSIC MASTERPIECE:

Half-Life 2 is one of the best games ever created. When I start playing I just couldn't stop.

When Half-Life 2 come out in November 2004 the whole world just stop. Everybody was playing this amazing innovative art form full action paste game. The graphic are the best I ever see in any other games until like 2010.

Half Life 2 was just In front of his time. Facial animations and detailed characters are even better than in some new blockbuster games that come out in 2017.

The sound is one of the best I ever hear in any video game.

Valve just make the greatest game ever. Since it passed like 13 years from Half Life 2 release, people still buy it today.

From amazing physics and outstanding level design to ultra realistic blood and atmospheric music is what makes Half Life 2 such a great game. Definitely deserves "Game of the decade" game award.

Also the feeling of shooting and looks of the guns is just remarkable.

Overall Half Life 2 bring us the most satisfied memories of our childhood when we play and talk about this great game since 2004 every single day.

One thing is for sure.  Half -Life 2 make my childhood better. 

Thank you Valve to make this masterpiece, and thank you that you fulfilled my childhood with amazing warm memories to the rest of my life.

10/10

I love this Game.

It has an Amazing storyline, and great, memorable characters. The dramatic scences of the Gman, and the intense action of the gunfights. This game is one of the best I've ever played. Both expansion packs have even more intense action, with new places to explore and more chapters to play. Even though this game has nearly 0 replayability, it was still amazing the next dozen times, exploring new areas and easter eggs you wouldn't have discovered at first. Thank you Valve for making such a wonderful game. (Even though you won't make episode 3)

Half-Life 2 (mit Cinematic Mod 2013)

Obwohl ich den Vorgänger damals echt super gerne gespielt habe ist es mir unbegreiflich wie der 2. Teil so viele Jahre an mir ungespielt vorbeigehen konnte. Deshalb hab ich das nun 12 Jahre später nachgeholt, und hier meine Einschätzung aus der aktuellen Zeit und mit der wunderbaren Mod "Cinematic 2013" die ich nur jedem empfehlen kann.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1105401198

[b]POSITIVES[/b]

+ Gesichtsanimationen und Mimik (Source Engine) waren damals bahnbrechend und sind auch heute noch gut
+ neue Texturen und Textureffekte wie HighRes und Bumpmapping
+ SweetFX Nachbearbeitung
+ Blooming der Sonne und Lichter
+ schönes Wasser (übrigens auch ohne Mod)
+ deutlich dunklere Beleuchtung und gesättigtere Farben (ohne Mod ist HL2 viel zu hell und blass)
+ Physik-Effekte (Havok-Engine) die das Spiel auch Spielmechanisch nutzt und nicht nur Zierde sind
+ Spielwelt ist mit viel mehr Objekten, neuen Bäumen und dergleichen gefüllt und wirkt dadurch noch realistischer und weniger karg
+ Charakter-Pimper mit dem diverse Charaktermodelle ausgetauscht werden können
+ Soundtracks und Soundeffekte (jedes Geräusch hat eine Funktion für Gameplay und Narrative und gefallenen Combine Soldaten folgen Funksprüche)
+ wirklich abwechslungsreiches Leveldesign und Umgebung von der Stadt, über Kanäle bis hin zur Geisterstadt oder Stränden
+ Einschusslöcher und teilzersplitterndes Glas
+ gute KI die sich auch zurückziehen, dem Spieler umzingeln oder diesem in den Rücken fallen kann; Gegner koordinieren sich, geben Feuerschutz und gehen in Deckung
+ neben den vielen klassischen Waffen, wie der Brechstange, Pistole, Machinenpistole, Schrotflinte, Granaten oder dem lasergesteuerten Raketenwerfer und der Armbrust, gibt es auch die legendäre und innovative Gravity-Gun, eine Art Schwerkraftkanone mit der man die wildesten Sachen machen kann
+ einfallsreiche Gegner wie die Headcraps (facehopperartige Biester), der Mannschnitter (fliegende Kreissägen), die pheromongesteuerten Ameisenlöwen, oder 
+ sehe coole Bosskämpfe
+ Performance Traum
+ unterhaltsame Story und glaubwürdige Spielwelt
+ sehr schöne Rätsel die harmonisch in die Welt eingefügt sind und in denen oft Physik eine Rolle spielt
+ Fahrzeugeinsatz (Sumpfboot, Buggy und später noch ein Dodge Charger)
+ der Begleiter Døg

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1105629636

[b]NEGATIVES[/b]

- geschnittene deutsche Version in Form von grauem Blut, einige zensierte Cutscenes und Zensur bei der Zerteilung von Zombies mittels Sägeblättern und verschwindende Leichen (zu letzterem siehe Tipp unten)
- deutsche Synchronisation hört sich oft an als wurde sie von den Praktikanten gemacht
- Gordon bleibt stets stumm
- nervige "Lade Daten" Unterbrechungen
- Schlauchlevel mit immer nur einem richtigen Weg
- destruktive Begleit-Rebellen

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1105671546

[b]FAZIT[/b]

Nach dem "Portal-Sturm" eroberten die außerirdischen Combine die Erde innerhalb von 7 Stunden und durchnummerierten die verbliebenen Städte. In "City 17" wird Gordon Freeman "der richtige Mann am falschen Ort" Teil der dortigen Untergrundbewegung unter denen sich auch ehemalige Black-Mesa-Arbeiter befinden. Zusammen mit einem H.E.V.-Suit, einer Brechstange und Alyx geht es nach Black Mesa East und rein in die Action.
Der Nachfolger des Ego-Shooters Half-Life ist mit Release 2004 zwar schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen, ist aber auch heute noch gut spielbar und technisch über jeden Zweifel erhaben.
Die Handlung ist zwar sehr linear, aber dennoch recht gut und interessant. Jeder Abschnitt kommt einem fast vor wie neues Spiel, so stark unterscheiden sich diese von der Stimmung und der Atmosphäre. Über Action bis hin zu Horror bietet das Spiel ein recht breites Setting und ein makelloses Gameplay.
HL2 hat sehr viele Dinge angestoßen und somit zukünftige Shooter und andere Spiele maßgeblich beeinflusst. Auch Steam haben wir diesem Spiel zu "verdanken", da die Vertriebsplattform gleich mitentwickelt wurde. Alleine schon deshalb ist dies eines der bedeutendsten Spiele auf dieser Plattform und ein Stück Spielegeschichte.
HL2 macht durchgehend Spaß, ist nie frustrierend, und weiß immer wieder zu überraschen. Von mir ein klarer Daumen nach oben.

PS: Falls ihr den Cut der deutschen Version umgehen wollt: Startet das Spiel mit Konsole (einmal Rechtsklick auf Half Life 2 -> Eigenschaften -> Startoptionen festlegen und da "-console" eingeben) und dort gebt ihr dann folgenden Befehl ein "g_ragdoll_lvfadespeed 0". Nun verschwinden keine Leichen mehr! ;)

Hier mein Review zu:
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198006784126/recommended/362890/]Black Mesa (Half-Life 1 Remake)[/url]

Wenn ihr an weiteren Reviews von mir interessiert seid, dann folgt meiner [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10868887-Dark-Chummer%27s-Reviews/?appid=63110]Gruppe[/url].

With [i]Half-Life 2[/i], Valve released not just a blockbuster sequel, but also a reason to play computer games.

[b]++[/b] Gameplay formula is the same as [i]Half-Life[/i], but [i]Half-Life 2[/i] takes the interaction to a higher level. Depending on the difficulty level, the AI can range from somewhat challenging to brutal. Having someone fight with and help the player (like Alyx) and giving commands is nice. Weapons are very different from one another and are mechanically logical and either original or improved, ranging from the basic pistols, shotguns, and submachine guns to the iconic box-breaking crowbar to commanding an army of spawning bugs with bugbait to the Gravity Gun for picking up, zapping, and throwing things, the aforementioned of which makes an honorable addition in combat and puzzles. There are more opportunities to do in the game, such as using a buggy, an airboat, or even a crane as both a utility and a weapon, as well as doing completely idiotic things that provoke a response of astonishment from the other characters. It retains the fast pace, and it is more destructive, immersive and adrenaline-inducing, and interactive than the original.
[b]++[/b] The scripting is the closest to perfect. One cannot simply dismiss any of the characters as inanimate or unwitty without trying to make oneself do so, and Alyx would be considered the greatest NPC sidekick at the time of release. She not only delivers the lines, but also is caring, looking out for Gordon, and strives to help him in any dire situation. The setting, unlike most games before or since, manages to capture the horrors of living in dystopia under fascism, and allows us to take it seriously and care for the slaves. Surely, games with similar stories attempted to capture the same image, but they often are taken too lightly to provoke any feeling of despair in the setting. Again, there are no cutscenes, and the plot points are orchestrated well enough to leave out inconsistencies and also elaborate on the events of the original [i]Half-Life[/i] and what the Breen Administration (the administration of Wallace Breen, the Earth's dictator and representative) is doing to control humanity. The role of previously hostile Vortiguants as part of the Resistance is also amazing, and fighting as a rebel against the cops is satisfying. It ultimately involves in accomplishing the most daring of all: the coup d'état of Breen's government.
[b]++[/b] While obviously outdated by today's standards (though not for 2004's), Source engine is perhaps one of the greatest engines in history. The graphics are nVidia-photorealistic, and the physics at the time of release were the closest to being real-world physics. The sound quality is also laudable such that there do not appear to be any artifacts during the recording of the sounds. It is as interactive and animate as the GoldSrc engine, and like that engine, Source supports mods, with excellent possibilities.
[b]=[/b] For those who like multiplayer, this game does not include the mode, although it is sold separately at half the price, and there are folks that hardly ever play multiplayer anyway.
[b]-[/b] Though fairly divisive in functionality and somewhat more original and improved, with three fewer weapons than [i]Half-Life[/i]'s 14, the weapon arsenal is a bit more casualized than I would have liked it.

[b]SCORE: 98%[/b]

After recently playing Half Life 2, it is hard to recommend it, but it does not mean that the game is bad in any shape. In my opinion it suffers from something other games of its age mostly don’t. It has aged quite poorly. 

No doubt that at the time the game came out it was very advanced (except maybe AI), and still to this day many people like the Source engine for its detailed physics. But the source engine is in many aspects the main issue. Other popular Valve games made on the Source engine have been released, and they have a very similar feel to them. Take Garry’s Mod for instance. It uses many Half Life assets, and you have probably tried it out already. Half Life 2 combat just does not feel as fresh or interesting after you have played other Source games for countless of hours. Meanwhile on the story side it is just as good as it came out, and stands out among other single player shooters. 

It is a great game, but I recommend trying out the first Half Life either with mods or not first.

Долгий сюжет

Начну с того, что считаю эту игру, не побоюсь сказать, одной из самых лучших игр всех времён и народов: 

- Интересный и насыщенный сюжет. 
- Неповторимая атмосфера. 
- Классный звук, крутая музыка (саунд дизайнеры, вам отдельное от меня спасибо). 
- В меру сложный геймплей. 

...поэтому, парень, покупай/качай - не пожалеешь и, уж поверь, ещё не раз перепройдёшь!
